page.title: 19COMPUTERS IN THE 1980'S
page.content: Computers are a large part of our lives and are often used at home as games machines. A group of 12 year olds were interviewed about their favourite computer games and it was discovered that the most popular game was{ {Frogger.}This is an arcade game in which the frog, controlled by the player, has to cross over the road dodging the rush hour traffic and then across the river. The school's head of computers, Mr.J. Pearson believes that software for schools needs futher development. A disadvantage is that only a few can use the software at one time. He thinks however, that computers will become cheaper, smaller and very much improved and will therefore be more widely used in schools.
